_header: Mercy and Truth met on a high mountain
_description: A Praise of Peace, by Lydgate — twenty-four 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) with ‘pees’ last word of each stanza

CamJes56.First Lines:
[M]ercye and truth met on a high mountaynBright as þe sonne
                    with his bemys clere…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…Gladest kalendys to euery cristen Reameffor vs to come to
                    ever lastyng pees

CamTCC601.First Lines:
mErcy and Trowthe met on an hygh monteyneBryght as the son with hys
                    beames clerePease and Iustyce walkyng on the pleyneAnd with iiii
                    sustres most goodly of theyre chere…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…Gladdest kalendes to euery crystyn Reameffor vs to come to
                    euerlastyng Pese
CamTCC601.Attributed Author: John lidgatt monke of bury (added by later hand, f. 290)

BLHar2255.First Lines:
MErcy and trouthe mette on an hih mounteynBriht as the sonne with
                    his beemys cleer…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…Gladdest kalendis to euery cristen Reemffor vs to come to
                    evir lastyng pees
